results.title: The Lion King: Simba's Mighty Adventure for Game Boy Color
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, plastic cartridge case, registration card, consumer information booklet and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Simba’s Mighty Adventure is based on Disney’s The Lion King as well as it’s direct-to-video sequel Simba’s Pride. The game consists of ten side-scrolling levels: The first six are set in The Lion King and the rest in Simba’s Pride, with some levels ending in boss fights. The game tracks along with the plot of both films and follows Simba as he grows up. Key events, such as the stampede from the first film, make up their own levels. Simba moves by running, jumping and climbing. Jumping can also be used to defeat the snakes, spiders, or monkeys that get in Simba’s way. He can also swipe at them with his claw or, as an adult, roar at them to make them flee.

Aiding Simba in his journey are collectibles that grant extra lives, refill or extend Simba’s health or fill a special amulet. Collecting all five parts of the amulet grants an extra life and opens up a mini-game that can be played main menu. The game also has a mulitplayer element. Using a Gameboy Colour link cable with another player opens up an extramode where each player has to hold onto a star for as long as possible by avoiding the opposing player’s attacks.

results.title: Reach for the Stars for PC
results.creator_credit: Strategic Simulations, Inc. and Strategic Studies Group
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD case insert, CD jewel case, licence agreement and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Reach for the Stars is a re-released and updated version of the DOS era game of the same name, the earliest example of a game in the 4X genre. The player starts off in a single planetary system and must eventually create and run an interstellar empire. In typical 4X style, this is done by exploring the universe around the player, expanding by claiming new territory, exploiting any resources in the area and exterminating any opponents along the way. The re-release features updated graphics and new scenarios for the player.

results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case with insert and manual in a cardboard box
results.brief_description: A sequel to Cricket 96 and an expansion to Cricket 97, Cricket 97: Ashes Tour Edition further improves on the series’ graphics, featuring stadiums rendered in three-dimensions, a series first. Cricketing legends Ritchie Benaud and Ian Botham have been added to provide commentary and are featured in full motion video interludes. The Ashes Tour Edition introduces enhancements such as real players’ names and stats, a larger stadium, an instant replay function, and minor gameplay improvements.

results.title: Carriers at War 1941-1945: Fleet Carrier Operations in the Pacific for DOS
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. Two 3 1/2 inch floppy disks, colour map, product registration card, subscription card and manual in a cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Carriers at War 1941-1945: Fleet Carrier Operations in the Pacific is a war simulation game. In the game, the player takes on the role of the task force commander in the Pacific Theater during World War II. The player can play as both the U.S. and the Japanese Empire in scenarios such as Pearl Harbor, Coral Sea, Midway, Eastern Solomons, Santa Cruz and Philippine Sea. The game is played on a 72x84 hexagonal grid on which different units and squadrons, such as naval vessels and land based aircraft, are positioned. The player chooses actions for these units, the consequences for which are simulated by the computer. The game is quasi real-time, meaning that the game can be paused at any given moment at which time the player can give orders to the units. All interaction with the game is through a menu interface. Orders that can be given to units include strike, escort, transport, support, refuel and more complex maneuvers such as strike routines.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/goldfields/

Last accessed: 6/05/2021

Original game developed by Strategic Studies Group for Commodore 64, published in 1984 by Strategic Studies Group

results.brief_description:
In the world of WipEout, anti-gravity racing is the world’s most popular sport. Tracks stretch out across the world and research is focused on finding even better and faster race craft. Racing for one of four corporations, the player competes to win the prestigious F3600 Anti-Gravity Racing League. Each corporation’s craft has its own strengths and weaknesses, which are further complicated by the choice of different pilots. Races aren’t simply affairs of speed and manoeuvring. The tracks are littered with weapons and powerups to hinder opponents or aid the player.

The game has three modes. Championship has the player attempting to place in the top three of each class, before proceeding to the next. If a player beats this mode in as the top of the Venom class, Rapier class, with tougher opponents, will be unlocked. Single Race pits the player against a full field of pilots in a single track. Time Trail is like single race, but without weapons.

results.title: WipEout 2097 for Sega Saturn
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and manual in Sega Saturn case
results.brief_description: WipEout 2097 is set four decades after its predecessor. The F3600 anti-gravity racing competition from the first game has been replaced by an even faster and more dangerous tournament: the F5000 AG league. The racing and weapon use gameplay from the original WipEout remains the same. The main modes from have also returned, but with the addition of a new Challenge Modes. Completing challenges in this mode rewards the player with faster race speeds, new tracks, and new vehicles.

results.title: Warlords for PC
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. Three 5 1/4 inch floppy disks, colour map, subscription card, IBM Supplement sheet, Version 2.0 Improvements Sheets and Appendix Sheets in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Warlords is set in the midst of the battle to control the Kingdom of Illuria. The player is put in control one of eight budding empires: The Sirians, Storm Giants, Grey Dwarves, Orcs of Kor, Elvallie, Horse Lords, Selentines, or Lord Bane. Each group has their strengths and weaknesses. The other clans are either controlled by the computer or by another player via hot seat play. The game proceeds on a turn-by-turn basis, with each player issuing commands such as to move units, attack the opposition, order cities to accrue gold, build more units or instruct their heroes to explore Illuria and complete quests before passing the turn to the next player. The game is won once a player has conquered at least half of the kingdom’s eighty cities.
results.description: Warlords is set in the midst of the battle to control the Kingdom of Illuria. The player is put in control one of eight budding empires: The Sirians, Storm Giants, Grey Dwarves, Orcs of Kor, Elvallie, Horse Lords, Selentines, or Lord Bane. Each group has their strengths and weaknesses. The other clans are either controlled by the computer or by another player via hot seat play. The game proceeds on a turn-by-turn basis, with each player issuing commands such as to move units, attack the opposition, order cities to accrue gold, build more units or instruct their heroes to explore Illuria and complete quests before passing the turn to the next player. The game is won once a player has conquered at least half of the kingdom’s eighty cities.

results.title: Warlords: Battlecry for PC
results.creator_credit: Strategic Simulations, Inc. and Strategic Studies Group
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case, CD case insert, reference card, epilepsy warning sheet, advert and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: As part of the Warlords series, Warlords Battlecry retains the fantasy setting and tactical focus of its predecessors. However, if shifts from the wargame genre that the series is known for to a mix of real-time strategy and roleplaying. The players commands one of nine races – Human, Dwarf, Undead, Barbarians, Orcs, Minotaurs, High Elves, Wood Elves and Dark Elves. True to real-time strategy genre, buildings must be created, units trained, upgrades researched and resources gathered. Unique to this game is the addition of hero units, which can complete quests and gain experience, strength and skills, unlike the other units in their army.

Unique to this game is the addition of hero units, which can complete quests and gain experience, strength and skills, unlike the other units in their army.
description_for_label: As part of the Warlords series, Warlords Battlecry retains the fantasy setting and tactical focus of its predecessors. However, if shifts from the wargame genre that the series is known for to a mix of real-time strategy and roleplaying. The players commands one of nine races – Human, Dwarf, Undead, Barbarians, Orcs, Minotaurs, High Elves, Wood Elves and Dark Elves. True to real-time strategy genre, buildings must be created, units trained, upgrades researched and resources gathered. Unique to this game is the addition of hero units, which can complete quests and gain experience, strength and skills, unlike the other units in their army.

results.title: Warlords III: Reign of Heroes for PC
results.creator_credit: Red Orb Entertainment and Strategic Studies Group
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case, advert, card game advert, registration card, troubleshooting guide, internet guide and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: The third instalment in the Warlords series boasts improved graphics throughout and retains much of the same turn-based strategy gameplay as its predecessors. The units a player can train are now not set to a specific clan, as new types of units from different clans can join the player’s faction. Also new to the series is the addition of diplomacy, where a player can forge treaties with others and conquer opponents together. This includes the ability to bribe others in order to influence their decisions. Lastly, while the game still allows for hotseat and play by email multiplayer, it now has the ability to play over the internet.
